Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: PMRad
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay there for business trip to Dubai as it has good location & normal service.

Reviews.Title: “Good news and Bad news”
Reviews.Author: adfrancis
Reviews.Content: The Carlton Tower is ideally placed with a short 5 min stroll to the Gold and Spice markets. The river is across the road so position is excellent. Problem is that the reception staff look like they have been told the world will end in a few months. Never seen such a miserable group of people. The concierge though was excellent. I was told by reception that I had to pay the bill on checkout and the woman was quite rude. Then she realised that my company was paying the bill and simply grunted. No apology The rooms are adequate and quite large and for the rate they are good for value. Bit used looking but I would stay there again. At the moment it is a 3.5 star hotel. Cheer the reception staff up and tell them that it is them that the customer sees first and you will have a 5 star. So easy to fix the problem but someone isn't getting it. Some people look but don't actually see.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: silsila11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days. I would say that my stay was wonderful. The rooms were clean and bathroom was quite big. I was disturbed on the first nite becoz of the nite club situated in the first floor. I asked for a change of room which they promptly obliged, and i got it this time on the 9th floor. The hotel has good view of the creek. Also the metro station is within walkable distance. The breakfast spread was adequate, nothing fancy. The front office especially the girl whose name i dont remember was very polite and helpful. I would recommend this place anytime to my close friends!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: First of all, no towels or toilet paper in the bathroom upon arrival, and I had to call room service, who brought these after 10pm. Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and booked as a package (Bed and Breakfast) Tried breakfast first morning, no glasses for juice or cups for coffee available. Requested for a clean glass and cup, but even after finishing the breakfast, none available or brought to the table. Brought it under the attantion of the waiter and front desk. Although booked for 4 nights, the room key did work only for one entry and you need to go back to front desk to activayte the room key after each use. Really uncomfortable. Last but not the least, the rooms and the floors have a very bad mold smell. It is really disgusting and not healthy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of scam with mini-bar!”
Reviews.Author: Bah881
Reviews.Content: Hello, I am writing this review as the alert for tourists who will stay in this hotel. My father stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. He was on a business trip. Previously he stayed in this hotel and he hadn't encountered any problems. The room was a bit old. The quality of hotel service has deteriorated. This time when he was checking out of the hotel, the reception told him that he had to pay for a consumed bottle of whisky from his room's mini-bar. When he told them that he did not drink anything from the mini-bar, they brought a bottle whisky from his room's minibar. That bottle was full (!), but slightly opened. You should know that my father does not consume alcohol at all. He was in a hurry to catch a flight, so he tried to argue a bit with them, but eventually he was UNFAIRLY charged 100 Dirhams for that whisky bottle. When he came back home, he was deeply frustrated with the management of this hotel. That is why he asked me to write this review on his behalf. So when you check in to this hotel, you should check the mini-bar and its contents.

Reviews.Title: “It is the worst hotel I've ever visited.”
Reviews.Author: Green_Greeen
Reviews.Content: - courtesy of front desk is very low - Rooms displayed online are just just pictures of coming renovation not the real existing rooms. And the existing rooms are very old and do not deserve to be rated more than 1 star. - the worst thing happened is that at night when we came back to sleep the lobby was full of drunken bar clients crawling out of the entrance and allowed music from the night club shakes the floor. worst, people coming to the night club used the same lift as hotel guests and they smell of alcohol and tobacco. - starting from the lobby and continuing to all the rooms and the floors a smell of mold and humidity. It is really disgusting and not healthy at all. - For us after seeing all these bad things we checked out at late night without sleeping one night.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience. Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Astroheart
Reviews.Content: Well first of all, the real room are ABSOLUTELY NOT the same as those in pictures published online. When you enter the lobby you will see a picture of that lovely room with LCD tv and all with a note underneath saying this is an upcoming upgrade. The existing room however, is old fashion, with an old CRT tv, and bed sheets are, well... To me are questionable at the least. Room amenities are lacking. For example, you don't find that slipper you usually find in hotels. When you enter the low ceiling lobby, the first thing that catches your attention is not any special decoration, but a moldy humid smell. This smell follows you up to the rooms floors, and some may get used to it but not me. And I guess this is not really hygienic... In the evening the lobby is full of drunkards stumbling out of the really noisy night club. Also, club dwellers share the same lifts as room guests. This is barely tolerable with the smell of alcohol mixing with tobacco... Really it's a shame because location on the Dubai creek is nice, but the hotel as is right now Is not recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, convenient but dirty and breakfast is poor, we try other hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: Smlow
Reviews.Content: The location is adequate with shuttle to the nearest shopping mall with MRT. But rooms cleanness was lacking, no cold water to adjust temperature for bathing , breakfast is poor not up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, BRILLIANT location.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Dan1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many, many times on business. Basic rooms, average cleanliness, average food but brilliant location keeps me coming back. The service is ok but the pool is excellent. You can always eat up the road at the Raddison SAS with its many excellent resturants, pubs etc... but the Dubai traffic is hideous no matter where you go. But from here you can walk or take an abra to many attractions. The docks are across the road for a real view from your window of true local custom, the Gold Souk or Naif Souk are a walk away or cross the creek by abra (local boat) for 1 dirham to access the other side of the city. the Dubai Big Bus tour stops right across the road from the hotel. Very convenient for a short stay and close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love it”
Reviews.Author: missangeCanada
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we are staying here. The rooms are a fair size. This time, we had the creekside view, which is very nice. The hotel is 10 minutes from the airport. It takes 15 minutes to get to the Gold Souk or Mina Bazaar by taxi. There are also abras that take you across for cheap. Cheap restaurants on the back side. Has different nightly entertainment-our favorite was the Indian music.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS UPGRADING !”
Reviews.Author: LondonWolfeee
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel in the center of Dubai with easy access to the Dubai Mall and other attractions. Good front office services including bell boys. Breakfast service and decor are of 1 star standard and just awful! All Restaurants are heavely frequented by prostitutes....

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: AngelnetworkDubai
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated hotel, very convenient location, over looking the creek what a view!. The staff are friendly and hey! the breakfast restaurant is also nice. I will defenitely comeback to this hotel and would recomment it to all. Walking distance also to the gold souk.

Reviews.Title: “great value and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mex23
Reviews.Content: 10 mins away from airport and right on the creek and 15 mins away from the most famous hotel burj al arab

Reviews.Title: “On, not up, the Creek”
Reviews.Author: Rost
Reviews.Content: Dubai [DXB] used to be good. Now it is materialism gone mad. How may we still enjoy DXB? One answer is to stay on a Creek side hotel. Carlton is one of the better value such places. A few yards from the Creek, from an Abra [water taxi] stations, and from the Souks 'Old' & 'Gold'. Good access to the DXB Airport. Excellent Creek view pool, with well equiped gym. Go for a Creek view room if premium price is reasonable. Look out for the Business Centre internet access rip off. Eat in the hotel; good buffet breakfast or outside in the strets to the rear. Good prices in the backstreet shops as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Nice breakfast, Freindly staff-shame about the service....”
Reviews.Author: SSS123Uk
Reviews.Content: I was told this hotel has a nice view, which was true. However I was not told about the type of service. The people at the front were friendly and always smiled but booking a cab would take forever. At the same time when we planned to go out on a trip- which was organised by the hotel, we were delayed by 40 minutes on both occasions both going and coming back! I nearly got into a fight with one of the drivers. Having said that, the breakfast was nice and the room itself was nice, had a great view. We were on the 11th floor which did not have a lift, so we had to take the steps from the 10th. Hotel, was clean etc. Its a nice place to stay, if youre going to be out and about- but dont book events directly from the hotel- you wil get ripped off and the staff will try to undercut each other in order to get you a better offer on a trip- making money for themselves at the same time- offcourse this is a good thing for the customer but it just sheds light on how people operate. It was also 5 mins walk to mcdonalds, KFC, Baskin and Robbins and a few restaurants. Overall a nice place to stay, friendly staff, just dont book things from there.

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteCEngland
Reviews.Content: Hi; I would like to say that my stay at Carlton Tower - was quiet pleasant. Yes, i will agree with the other reviews that there is renovation work beign done in the hotel, but it is on the ground level (in front of the hotel), and it had no impact on my stay. I was staying in room 1001 and i was amazed by the view on the creek side. I was happy with the service provided, it was also good to know that they had an in-house health club and a swimming pool. I would say that over all it is a nice hotel to stay, some improvement could take place in terms of providing varieties of cusines for dinner - such as oriental dishes - i do love oriental cusines. I am sure that the next time i visit Carlton - there will a variety of dishes.

Reviews.Title: “hope it gets better”
Reviews.Author: nler
Reviews.Content: i've been a regular guest at this hotel, and i'm sad to say it's on the decline. the only thing keeping it going is the concierge staff, always helpful and friendly in contrast to the rest of the staff. i only hope they get their act together. it's one of the few places in dubai that has some human character.

Reviews.Title: “Be Brave Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: emmalouise76
Reviews.Content: My goodness. Arrived here at 02.30 in the morning on a business trip with my manager. Arrived at the hotel to a fight breaking out in the front of the hotel. Checked in after a long wait so I would dread to think how long it would take in peak season. The room was terrible and I even had to check the sheets to make sure they were clean. There was no hot water in the morning for a shower and breakfast.... what can you say. Looking at it made me loose my appetite. Tinned fruit looked the most eatable. Requested a taxi and told we had to wait 20 minutes so decided to wonder down the road for one. Decided to drink and eat at a different hotel (Hilton Dubai Creek) as we had stayed here before and knew we could not be let down by the service and quality. Thank goodness we did as upon our return to the hotel we decided to go for a night cap. Thought we would try out the English Bar (no longer English) and there was no one there, so we decided to try the other bar and at least that provided entertainment for an hour or 2. Had a few quick drinks then went back to the room. Booked a wake up call for 06.15 and that came through at 06.45 so I was glad I set the alarm on my phone. None of the buttons on the top of the phone worked, and half the lights in the bedroom did not work. No really great views from the Hotel. I had a view of the creek, but due to no sound proof windows all you could hear were the car horns and my mangers view was of the rather tatty looking apartments opposite the hotel. If you decide to stay here be warned.

Reviews.Title: “What a wreck”
Reviews.Author: Frustra
Reviews.Content: I`m glad I stayed only 2 nights. Breakfast was like something from 1940s Britain. TINNED fruit salad, TINNED Peaches, TINNED Pears in a 4 Star Hotel. The brightest things in the Lobby were the Black and White pictures of the opening day in 1977 The staff tried their best. "Just another 30 minutes , Sir" when the water was turned off until 10.00 a.m. We were told by a note slipped under the door it would be off until 07.00. A fine position though.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zuckerbussi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Deira district, almost direclty on Dubai Creek. We stayed there for two nights. Our room has been clean and quite large - but nothing special. Breakfast was not really fine either. Would recommend this hotel to everyone, who gets a special rate but don't expect anything special or fine. Hotel should be rated as a good three-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for your dream holiday”
Reviews.Author: amxgod
Reviews.Content: Well it's not bad but I wouldn't say 4-star myself. I was a guest for 4 nights and while the staff were all very helpful it didn't feel like 4-star service. The breakfast is pretty standard, nothing that would really make you dash down from your room. I had the lunch buffet once only, I arrived as soon as it opened but many of the dishes were already cold and again not very exciting. I got a really great deal on the room but had I been paying anywere near the rack rate I would have been less than pleased. Things to look out for, they didn't restock the mini-bar or coffee etc each day, the complementary water was not replaced each day, you only get 1 toilet roll, in fact only half on the first day as the rest had been used by the last guest (no-spare in the room). On the plus side I did arrive at 8am in the morning and there was a room ready right away and the airport transfer they aranged was fine is more expensive than a taxi. On the whole it's ok for a few days if you are business or on a budget but it's not a spot for your dream holiday.

Reviews.Title: “should be called Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Nodanger
Reviews.Content: We arrived recently at The Carlton Towers Dubai Creek hotel, Monday 11th. September for three nights and were extremely disappointed with the room not being ready on our arrival even although we had paid for it from 12 noon that day and didn't arrive until 3.45am. the next morning.after a long 10hr. journey. We were told that the air conditioning had just broken down (as if) it couldn't have been fixed or another room made ready before we arrived so we were told that we could wait in another smaller room as we had paid for a triple room while another room was getting ready and were given free coffee and a room with a view of the creek (which we had requested anyway)to make up for this and we would be in the other room for 4.20-4.30.am,so at 5.15 am we were taken to another room with our luggage only to find that someone else was sleeping there and had the latch chain lock on the door otherwise we would have walked in on them.so we then were taken to another room 1002 this time which was the one at the creek with the view to make up for the stuffing around so around 6am. And after approximately ten hours travelling we managed to get to sleep.At ten am.4hours later I was awakened by a workman on scaffolding outside my window hammering and banging and singing,(and this was on the tenth floor) no privacy as you couldn't open the curtains as he was walking around outside on the scaffolding, the view was obscured by scaffolding and green shade cloth,and also the chances that the workmen could be there did not impress us we did complain only to be told that we could shift rooms again to one without a view as the workmen were due back the following morning again so we decided reluctantly (as it was only a three night stay and we were sick of the upheaval) not to move again.this was our first trip to Dubai and our experience was not good and it is a relief to be back in Australia ,I will be putting our experience on the travel forums and also contacting Emirates who we booked with, but felt to be fair that we should let you know first . PS. the manager also told us that they had informed travel agents and airline companies about the renovations i don't see anything about it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Jaded Carlton Tower”
Reviews.Author: GillianN91
Reviews.Content: There was a problem with the transfer from Abu Dhabi -as the Etihad coach actually took us their offices rather than to the bus station, so we had no transfer, and had to pay again for a taxi - worth noting that when you come back the offices book your cases straight through to your destination back in the UK. The Hotel Carlton Tower was a little jaded. The toilet flush wasn't working and broke again immediately after being fixed. The telephone wasn't working, the hairdryer broke during our stay. There were no enough sunbeds to go around so we had to sit on little aluminium chairs around the pool. The fire alarm went off and no one actually left the building!!

Reviews.Title: “Badddd”
Reviews.Author: BigAnthony
Reviews.Content: It is basically a very old hotel with a very old reception and a very bad service. The reception waked me up 4 times on 4 different wake up calls and i had not book any wake up call The breakfast is terrible The bath rooms are dirty The rooms are dirty

HotelInfo.Name: The Carlton Tower Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Baniyas Rd | PO Box 1955, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
